intro: Parinari neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia parinari, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that are typically orange or red in color. The tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for various wildlife species.
